I am a research scientist with over ten years of experience in the fields of genomics, stem cells, and computational biology. My current research focuses on *spatial omics* and the development of open source software to analyze large-scale scientific datasets. You can learn more about my research on my [Google Scholar page](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=K900TXsAAAAJ&hl=en) and my open source contributions on my [GitHub](https://github.com/Ed2uiz) or the [Open Source page](oss/opensource.qmd). I am currently a [Hariri Institute Graduate Student Fellow](https://www.bu.edu/hic/profile/edward-ruiz/) and Ph.D. Candidate at Boston University in the [Dries Lab](https://www.drieslab.com/).
